pain_points.description: The system works perfectly with 1-2 agents, but adding the third or fourth creates infinite loops, duplications, and conflicts that make the output unreliable.

pain_points.title: üîÑ Lack of Memory
pain_points.description: The system doesn't learn from previous experiences. Every task starts from scratch, without benefiting from lessons learned, creating systematic inefficiencies.

pain_points.title: üí∏ Unpredictable Costs
pain_points.description: Without architectural optimizations, API costs grow non-linearly with usage. Redundant calls and system inefficiency make scaling economically unsustainable.

items.question: Is it just theory or are there practical examples?
items.answer: This book is the opposite of theory. It's a "documented journey" with real war stories, production-ready code, and architectures tested on systems serving thousands of real users.

items.question: How technical is it? Do you need specific experience?
items.answer: Written for experienced developers and managers. Assumes familiarity with Python and APIs, but explains all AI-specific concepts. If you can make a REST call, you're ready.

items.question: Is it updated with the latest AI technologies?
items.answer: The book is based on architectural principles that transcend specific technologies. What worked with GPT-3 still works with GPT-4 and will work with future models.
